title: WPL 2024:  Big Blow As Expensive Uncapped Players Miss Out
content:
The Women's Premier League (WPL) 2024 has suffered a setback as two key players, Kashvee Gautam and Kanika Ahuja, have been ruled out due to injuries.  

Kashvee Gautam, who became the most expensive uncapped Indian player in the auction, was signed by the Gujarat Giants for a whopping Rs 2 crore. However, a stress fracture sustained in late 2023 has forced her out of the tournament. Gujarat has brought in Sayali Sathgare as a replacement. 

Meanwhile, Royal Challengers Bangalore's Kanika Ahuja has also been sidelined due to an undisclosed injury. Shradda Pokharkar has stepped in as her replacement. 

These injuries are a blow for both teams and fans, highlighting the importance of player fitness in the competitive world of women's cricket.
author: Scroll Staff
